free_txt: BP

bib_record.title: Actinide production in reactions of heavy ions with 248Cm

free_txt: A set of four Si(Au) surface barrier
detectors with active areas of 100 mm2.
No details on sources of uncertainties.
The gold recoil catcher foils
were processed using standard chemical procedures.
The foil was dissolved in a minimum volume of aqua
regia containing tracer nuclides of the elements Pa
(Z=91) to Am (Z=95) in order to obtain chemical
yields. After chemical processing, final samples were
counted either for gamma-ray activity or for alpha
particle and spontaneous fission decays, depending
upon the nuclides of interest.
Branching ratios and
half lives.
251Bk decay data.
The super heavy ion linear accelerator
(SuperHILAC).
Beams of 136Xe with average charge states of 29+ were
delivered to the target system at intensities up to 2
electrical microA.
Preliminary experiment performed with thin target.
The target used in these
experiments was 2.1 mg/cm2 Cm, vacuum evaporated as
the fluorides onto a 2.6 mg/cm2 foil of beryllium
metal in a 6.5 mm diameter spot. Recoiling reaction
products were collected with truncated conical foils
of 50 mg/cm2 gold or of 14 mg/cm2 aluminum.
Table I, pages 1318-1319.
The super heavy ion linear accelerator
(SuperHILAC).

25 min.
A beam of 111 MeV 18O4+ ions was delivered to a
target with intensities up to 3 electrical microA.
The target used in these
experiments was 0.5 mg/cm2 248Cm, electroplated
batchwise from an isopropanol solution onto a 2.3
mg/cm2 foil of beryllium metal in a 7 mm diameter spot.
Table I, pages 1318-1319.
